claim: The artist Aaron Boyd has illustrated 12 different types of cards.
reasoning: The claim states Aaron Boyd illustrated 12 different types of cards. Querying the database shows Aaron Boyd has only 2 distinct values in the 'types' column (Creature, Instant) and 4 distinct values in the 'type' column (Creature — Bird, Instant, Creature — Cat, Creature — Kavu). Neither interpretation yields 12, so the claim is contradicted by the data.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step.

content.text: I can see there's a `types` column and an `artist` column. The claim is about "types of cards" which maps to the `types` column. Let me query for the distinct types for Aaron Boyd.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT types FROM cards WHERE artist = 'Aaron Boyd';"
input.description: Get distinct card types for Aaron Boyd

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT types) FROM cards WHERE artist = 'Aaron Boyd';"
input.description: Count distinct card types for Aaron Boyd

content.text: Aaron Boyd has only illustrated 2 distinct types of cards (Creature and Instant), not 12. But let me also check if "types" could be interpreted differently — perhaps looking at the `type` column (full type line) instead:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT type FROM cards WHERE artist = 'Aaron Boyd';"
input.description: Get distinct full type lines for Aaron Boyd

content.content:
Creature — Bird
Instant
Creature — Cat
Creature — Kavu

tool_use_result.stdout:
Creature — Bird
Instant
Creature — Cat
Creature — Kavu

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT type) FROM cards WHERE artist = 'Aaron Boyd';"
input.description: Count distinct full type lines for Aaron Boyd

content.text:
Even using the `type` column (full type line), there are only 4 distinct types — still not 12. The claim says 12 different types, but the data shows either 2 (using `types`) or 4 (using `type`). This is clearly contradicted.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "The claim states Aaron Boyd illustrated 12 different types of cards. Querying the database shows Aaron Boyd has only 2 distinct values in the 'types' column (Creature, Instant) and 4 distinct values in the 'type' column (Creature — Bird, Instant, Creature — Cat, Creature — Kavu). Neither interpretation yields 12, so the claim is contradicted by the data."}
```
